subtitle: Strategic collaboration ecosystem
description: The Partners section of PROCUREDATA is dedicated to projects developed in collaboration with our strategic partners. Each partner has a dedicated space with specific functionalities, exclusive projects and access to shared data under strict governance protocols.
noPartnersFound: No partners found with selected filters

itbid.description: Leading public tender platform in Spain. Connects suppliers with public sector contracting opportunities, facilitating access to government procurement data.

aerce.description: Main professional procurement association in Spain with +3,000 members. Offers CPO (Chief Procurement Officer) certification and organizes the Purchasing Forum.

bme-espana.description: Spanish delegation of Germany's largest procurement association. Promotes European procurement standards and organizes BME Symposium in Spain.

asaja.description: Spain's largest agricultural organization with presence in all autonomous communities. Key for primary sector digitalization and agri-food chain traceability.

feique.description: Represents 100% of Spanish chemical industry (3,000 companies). Strategic sector generating €71,000M in revenue.

gaia-cluster.description: The heart of Industry 4.0 in Spain (Basque Country). Connects electronics, IT and telecommunications with Basque machine tools. +300 member companies.

22-barcelona.description: The innovation district par excellence in Catalonia. Concentrates IT, media and energy companies. More than 10,000 companies and 100,000 workers.

aeropolis.description: Europe's only science and technology park dedicated exclusively to aerospace industry (Andalusia). Includes Airbus suppliers.

food-i.description: Ebro Valley food cluster (La Rioja, Navarra, Aragón). Strategic for agri-food vertical, focused on traceability and food safety.

secartys.description: National electronics, solar energy and home automation industry. +300 technology sector companies.

valerdata.description: Specialists in enterprise data valuation and monetization. Data Spaces Kit Consumer with AI models for industrial price prediction.

bme.description: Germany's largest procurement management association with +9,500 members. Organizes BME Symposium (Europe's largest procurement event).

vda.description: German automotive industry association. Represents manufacturers like Volkswagen, BMW, Mercedes-Benz and their suppliers. Defines VDA standard.

vci.description: Represents German chemical industry, third largest in the world. +1,700 member companies including BASF, Bayer, Henkel.

zdb.description: German construction central federation. Represents 35,000 construction companies. Promotes digitalization (BIM) and sustainability.

bdew.description: Federal energy and water association. Represents +1,900 German energy sector companies. Key for energy transition (Energiewende).

wsm.description: Steel and metal processing industry association. Promotes Industry 4.0 in metallurgy.

dbv.description: German farmers' federation. Represents +300,000 farmers. Promotes precision agriculture and German field digitalization.

silicon-saxony.description: Europe's largest microelectronics and software cluster (Dresden). Semiconductor giants like Infineon, Bosch, Globalfoundries. +500 companies.

its-owl.description: Intelligent Technical Systems OstWestfalenLippe. Considered the home of Industry 4.0. Automation leaders like Beckhoff, Harting, Phoenix Contact.

medical-valley.description: One of the world's medical technology centers (Nuremberg). Vital for healthcare vertical and hospital procurement. +500 MedTech companies.

hamburg-aviation.description: One of the world's largest civil aviation clusters (Airbus headquarters). Full value chain: design, production and maintenance. +300 companies.

biorn.description: Biotechnology and life sciences cluster (Rhine-Neckar Region). Connects with pharmaceutical and chemical industry. +150 biotech companies.

adaci.description: Italian procurement and supply management association. Reference for professional certification in Italy. +5,000 procurement professionals.

anfia.description: Represents the entire Italian automotive supply chain: manufacturers, suppliers, coachbuilders. Key for electric vehicle transition.

federchimica.description: Italian chemical industry federation. Represents +1,400 sector companies. Promotes sustainable chemistry and circular economy.

ance.description: National builders association. Represents +20,000 Italian construction companies. Key for PNRR and green construction.

federmeccanica.description: Italian metalworking industry federation. Represents Italy's largest manufacturing sector. Promotes digital transformation.

motor-valley.description: World's most famous luxury automotive cluster (Emilia-Romagna). Ferrari, Lamborghini, Maserati, Ducati, Pagani. +16,000 companies.

packaging-valley.description: World leader in automatic packaging machinery (Bologna). Companies like IMA, Marchesini, Coesia. €8,000M revenue.

distretto-ceramica.description: Produces 80% of Italian ceramics (Sassuolo). Pioneers in sustainability and material recycling. +300 ceramic companies.

distretto-tessile.description: One of Europe's largest textile centers (Tuscany). Massive focus on 'circular fashion' and textile recycling. +7,000 companies.

aerospace-piedmont.description: Groups key aerospace and defense players in northern Italy (Leonardo, Thales Alenia Space). +350 companies.

cdaf.description: Company of Directors and Buyers of France. Main French procurement professionals association. Organizes Nuit des Achats.

pfa.description: French Automotive Platform. Coordinates French automotive industry. Promotes vehicle of the future and electrification.

uic.description: French Chemical Industries Union. Represents French chemical sector. Promotes green and sustainable chemistry.

ffb.description: French Building Federation. Represents construction companies. Promotes RE2020 and BIM in France.

fnsea.description: France's largest agricultural union. Represents farmers and ranchers. Promotes precision agriculture.

gifas.description: French aerospace and space industries group. Represents Airbus, Safran, Thales and their supply chain.

aimf.description: Mechanical and foundry industries association. Represents French industrial machinery sector.

aerospace-valley.description: World's most important aerospace cluster alongside Seattle (Toulouse/Bordeaux). +850 members. Airbus, Safran, Thales.

minalogic.description: Digital technologies innovation hub: micro-nano electronics, photonics, software (Grenoble). 'French Silicon Valley'. +500 companies.

systematic.description: Focused on Deep Tech (AI, Cybersecurity, Digital Twins). Hub where major French corporations develop digital standards. +900 members.

capenergies.description: Dedicated to energy transition and decarbonized energies (nuclear, solar, hydrogen) in Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur. +500 members.

biovalley-france.description: Trinational cluster (Germany and Switzerland) for health and biotechnology in Alsace. Excellent for cross-border pharmaceutical data. +350 companies.

nevi.description: Dutch procurement management association. Leader in certification and procurement training. Organizes NEVI Inkoopdag. +5,000 members.

rai.description: Dutch automotive industry association. Represents importers, distributors and manufacturers. Promotes sustainable mobility.

vnci.description: Dutch chemical industry association. Represents +100 sector companies. Leads transition to circular chemistry.

bouwend.description: Dutch construction association. Represents +4,500 companies. Pioneer in circular and sustainable construction.

lto.description: Dutch farmers and horticulturists organization. Represents Europe's most technified agricultural sector. Leader in AgriTech.

brainport-eindhoven.description: Probably Europe's smartest km² (headquarters of ASML, Philips, NXP, DAF). Semiconductor and high-tech epicenter. +1,500 companies.

food-valley.description: Agriculture and food Silicon Valley (Wageningen). Global food technology and alternative protein standards.

chemelot.description: Ultra-integrated chemical and materials industrial park (Limburg). Companies share energy and data flows. DSM, Sabic.

hsd.description: Europe's leading security cluster: cybersecurity, forensics, national security (The Hague). +300 security companies.

port-rotterdam.description: Functions as massive logistics and energy cluster. Leads global maritime supply chain digitalization. Europe's largest port.

apcadec.description: Portuguese procurement and supply association. Promotes professionalization and digitalization of procurement in Portugal.

aicep.description: Portugal's investment and foreign trade agency. Facilitates internationalization of Portuguese companies.

aip.description: Portuguese industrial association. Represents Portuguese manufacturing industry. Organizes FIL (Lisbon International Fair).

aed-cluster-portugal.description: Aeronautics, Space and Defense. Growing rapidly as European Tier-2 supplier. Companies like Embraer Portugal, OGMA. +130 companies.

health-cluster-portugal.description: Groups pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical devices industry. Promotes Portugal as health hub. +200 companies.

produtech.description: Production technologies cluster (North). Groups machinery and technology manufacturers for manufacturing industry. +200 companies.

tice-pt.description: ICT and Electronics competitiveness cluster. Digital umbrella for Portuguese transformation. +400 companies.

habitat-sustentavel.description: Focused on sustainable construction and materials (stone, ceramics, cork). Promotes sustainability in built environment. +200 companies.

agoria.description: Belgian technology industry federation. Represents +2,000 technology, manufacturing and digital services companies.

essenscia.description: Belgian chemistry and life sciences federation. Generates €65,000M in exports. World-class pharmaceutical cluster.

febiac.description: Belgian and Luxembourg automotive federation. Represents importers and distributors. Promotes electrified mobility.

biowin.description: Wallonia's health cluster. European reference in biopharmaceuticals and vaccines (GSK, UCB). +150 biotech companies.

antwerp-chemical.description: World's second largest chemical cluster after Houston. BASF, Bayer, Total, ExxonMobil. +500 chemical companies.

skywin.description: Walloon aerospace cluster. Focused on new materials and embedded systems for aviation. +130 companies.

dsp-valley.description: Specialized in intelligent electronic systems and signal processing (Leuven). IMEC, NXP. +100 companies.

flux50.description: Smart energy cluster: Smart Grids, energy efficiency (Flanders). +150 companies.

telenatura-ebt.description: Technology-based company specialized in agricultural automation, IoT and precision agriculture. Develops innovative solutions to optimize agricultural processes.

aracea.description: Environmental management tool developed by Oficemen for environmental risk analysis in Spanish cement plants. Facilitates compliance with Environmental Liability Law.

closerstill-media.description: Global leader in B2B trade fair organization. Enabler of the Digital Commerce Data Space through Madrid Tech Show (7 integrated fairs), E-Show Barcelona and Infarma. ProcureData integration: Flash Validation for exhibitors and Verified Matchmaking at eForums.
